# NSApplication.ModalResponse

**Structure**

A set of button return values for modal dialogs.

## Declaration

```swift
struct ModalResponse
```

## Discussion

The response value that a button returns can depend on which method is used to present the dialog. See [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAlert/alertWithMessageText:defaultButton:alternateButton:otherButton:informativeTextWithFormat:], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAlert/runModal()], and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAlert/addButton(withTitle:)] for examples.

## Responses

- **OK**: The presentation or dismissal of the sheet has finished.
- **cancel**: The presentation or dismissal of the sheet has been canceled.
- **continue**: Modal session is continuing (returned by [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/runModalSession(_:)] only).
- **stop**: Modal session was broken with [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/stopModal()].
- **abort**: Modal session was broken with [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/abortModal()].
- **alertFirstButtonReturn**: The user clicked the first (rightmost) button on the dialog or sheet.
- **alertSecondButtonReturn**: The user clicked the second button from the right edge of the dialog or sheet.
- **alertThirdButtonReturn**: The user clicked the third button from the right edge of the dialog or sheet.

## Deprecated Responses

- **NSRunStoppedResponse**: Modal session was broken with [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/stopModal()].
- **NSRunAbortedResponse**: Modal session was broken with [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/abortModal()].
- **NSRunContinuesResponse**: Modal session is continuing (returned by [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/runModalSession(_:)] only).

## Initializers

- **init(_:)**
- **init(rawValue:)**

## Constants

- **NSAlert.Style**: The set of alert styles to style alerts in your app.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
